theoryTitle: Shiryu Will Join the Blackbeard Pirates
theoryText: Based on the conversation between Blackbeard and Shiryu on Level 1, many fans theorized that Shiryu would betray Impel Down and join Blackbeard's crew. The mutual respect shown between these two ruthless characters, combined with Shiryu's history of excessive violence and imprisonment, suggested he would see Blackbeard as an opportunity for freedom and power rather than an enemy to fight.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidencePoints: Shiryu was released from prison for his excessive violence, showing he doesn't align with Impel Down's values
The conversation between Blackbeard and Shiryu was friendly rather than hostile
Shiryu showed interest in Blackbeard's purpose rather than immediately trying to stop him
Blackbeard's ability to recruit powerful allies was already established with his existing crew

theoryTitle: Magellan's Decision to Release Shiryu Will Backfire
theoryText: Fans theorized that Magellan's decision to release the dangerous and unpredictable Shiryu from his cell to help stop the prison riot would ultimately backfire, as Shiryu's loyalty to Impel Down was questionable at best. Many predicted that Shiryu would either refuse to help, cause more chaos, or even betray the prison entirely by joining one of the invading forces.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidencePoints: Shiryu was imprisoned for excessive violence against prisoners, showing his disregard for rules
Releasing a dangerous criminal to fight other criminals is inherently risky
Shiryu's character design and demeanor suggested he was untrustworthy
The narrative setup of Shiryu meeting Blackbeard immediately after being released suggested a connection

theoryTitle: The Blackbeard-Shiryu Alliance Will Have World-Changing Consequences
theoryText: Fans theorized that if Shiryu joined Blackbeard, it would have massive implications for the balance of power in the One Piece world. Combining Blackbeard's Devil Fruit powers and ambition with Shiryu's swordsmanship and knowledge of Impel Down could lead to the recruitment of Level 6 prisoners and the formation of an incredibly dangerous pirate crew that would challenge the existing power structure.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidencePoints: Shiryu's intimate knowledge of Impel Down's layout and prisoners would be valuable to Blackbeard
The timing of Blackbeard's arrival suggested he had a specific goal in the prison
Level 6 prisoners are some of the most dangerous criminals in the world
Blackbeard's pattern of recruiting powerful individuals for his crew was already established

theoryText: Given Shiryu's strength as the former Head Jailer (stated to be equal to Warden Magellan) and his eventual joining of the Blackbeard Pirates, fans theorized that Shiryu would become Blackbeard's right-hand man or second-in-command, similar to Zoro's role in the Straw Hat Pirates or Rayleigh's role with Roger.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidencePoints: Shiryu was stated to be equal in strength to Magellan, making him extremely powerful
His swordsmanship would complement Blackbeard's Devil Fruit powers
The parallel structure of rival crews in One Piece often features strong right-hand men
Shiryu's serious demeanor contrasts with some of Blackbeard's more eccentric crew members
